info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 29 at 6:41PM CDT until March 29 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Northern Glasscock County in western Texas... Southeastern Martin County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas...
* Until 745 PM CDT.
* At 641 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 13 miles north of Midland to near Greenwood, moving northeast at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph.
SOURCE...Trained weather spotters.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 152 and 193.
Locations impacted include... Sand Springs, Lomax, Coahoma, Stanton, Lenorah, Big Spring, Big Spring Country Club, Courtney, Forsan, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Knott, Stanton Municipal Aiport, Luther, and Elbow.
info.instruction:
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 7:45 PM CDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 7:45 PM CDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Glasscock, TX; Howard, TX; Martin, TX

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:45 PM CDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:45 PM CDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Glasscock, TX; Howard, TX; Martin, TX
